title: @Riot - The Mysterious 003 Error Is Interesting....

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
I opened up my League of Legends client today to update it to the newest patch which caused me to get the 'Error 003' message constantly so I restarted my computer. I double-clicked on the League of Legends icon on my desktop to start the client and I got the message which is included in the image link. 

I guess I just can't play League of Legends anymore because of (mom's) spaghetti code?

replies.body: Those 003 errors are a good sign that something might be blocking your connection with our servers or some of your network settings aren't configured in the best way for League. I'd run through the steps in the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), specifically the steps on port forwarding and DNS server settings.

I'm considering just uninstalling and then re-installing the client (mainly because I've been having recurring issues with lag, black screens, etc. ever since the League Client Update that happened earlier in the year). Do you think this could potentially resolve my issues, Dr. Professor Broporo?

Edit: I'm able to start up the PBE client but I'm afraid to update it because I fear that the same thing will happen to the PBE client as well. BASED Merrill - we need you.

Y'know, I'm glad you responded because I had read your topic and the body of your post without opening the screenshot. 003 Errors and the error message in your screenshot are separate errors that need different fixes so ignore the connection guide. 

For the issue in your screenshot, update your [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) to make sure League is able to access that game file, and if that doesn't work it could mean the file it damaged or missing. In that case, you'd wanna run a repair to fix the game files.
I'll give that a shot before I try running a repair/re-installation. Thanks for the advice.
